summary: Adds a new dungeon and related quest to the game. Work In Progress.
descriptionHtml:
The basic premise for the mod is this: the player is asked to clear out an old crypt by a man who left his journal inside on a recent exploration. The crypt turns out to be an old tomb rumored to contain several very powerful artifacts. A group of people from a guild is also after the artifacts, and the player has to decide who to side with. More details can be provided privately on request-I don't want to spoil it for anyone interested in playing the completed mod. 

More information will be added as progress continues.

New in the beta 1.1 version:
Alastair Diebin and his house are actually in the game now! Cobbleton Hall is outside of Riften and is fully navmeshed. 
Layout of Arachnel's Crypt has been [i]drastically [/i]overhauled and now includes basic navmesh. It isn't pretty-enemies may notice you but not run towards you.
Screenshots! All four of 'em, for everyone who wanted to see what they were getting themselves into.
The framework for the first quest has technically been in the mod since the first release, but it's now accessible due to Alastair existing and all that. It's nowhere near completed.
The entrance to Arachnel's Crypt was moved slightly to make it closer to sea level and easier to access. Staircase to Heaven outside of it was removed in favor of a fairly level dirt path.
Cleaned the mod with TES5Edit. Only a handful of vanilla records have been altered-these are all intentional. Cleaning my .ESP any further will probably cause issues, and those are all your fault.

Not yet implemented but worth mentioning:
Voice actors for the three main NPCs have been cast! Thanks PrinceOfOriel, Tatteredspyder, and Rufliane!

Known issues:
AI in Arachnel's Crypt is wonky due to horrible navmesh. I know. Please bear with me-I accidentally deleted the existing navmesh twice which has ruined my interest in navmeshing that particular cell for the moment.
Please let me know if you experience any bugs with lighting.
Three doors are locked in Arachnel's Crypt-one is a puzzle door with no activators, another is a wooden door, and the third is that ambiguous metallic stonelike door in the second room. The first two cannot yet be unlocked without console commands, but the third can-there's a key somewhere that appears after you accept Alastair's quest. At least, it should. t-t
author: Toast
